text:
Hey guys,
client wants to use CTA’s in the react components and it’s killing me. If the cta-field would give me other props than id, it prob wouldn’t be a that much of an issue. Is there a way that I could get the CTA info with that given id. Like API or something?

With new CTA’s I would need to have this `<a href="<https://cta-eu1.HubSpot.com/web-interactives/public/v1/track/redirect?encryptedPayload=AVxigLJ02a6Pro0bqcWqqzDW%2FVr8oJIwpcKD46Y7MmEk%2FxRXBKLgXnQWioQ742%2BUXTZ8xfPx4R%2FGlqzvnDjxFNt%2F3y5sX9Ai6G0BuBjswngadQSLig%3D%3D&webInteractiveContentId=75120886221&portalId=25192585>"` constructed

CTA field gives me id 75120886221. So I can get the `webInteractiveContentId`  and portalId there but where and how could I get the `encryptedPayload`  :grimacing:

Super quick question: I'm playing with storybook, wondering why arguments for module story methods are in different order? i.e.
```moduleStory(ModuleComponent, fields, storyArgs)
moduleStoryWithIsland(fields, moduleName, storyArgs)```

I know very little about the new CTAs. Tried to look a little in between meetings, but I do not have any helpful suggestions at the moment. Will try to reach out to get help, but I suspect we don’t have any helpful suggestions yet

:wave:  trying to remember the exact rationale - i think partially it was to make clear that the latter can’t take a `ModuleComponent` and it’s the string name coming in. maybe an ill-advised way to do that rather than just runtime type validation. i can look into swapping them to match

While i've got you, noticing that the iframe that `moduleStoryWithIsland` doesn't stretch the entire height of the parent storybook iframe. could you update the style attribute you're adding to the island iframe to
````border: none;width: 100%;height: 100%;overflow: auto;position: absolute;left: 0;top: 0;````
Or whatever css you like. The parent storybook iframe is absolutely positioned, so should play nice :slightly_smiling_face:
yup definitely - i think the styling around our iframe changed during the storybook beta when we first started working on it
